Within this entire Contemplation Sutra, I will first make seven sections to analyze it, and then explain the meaning according to the text.

First, first listing the preface title.
I humbly think that true suchness is vast, and the five vehicles cannot fathom its limits. The nature of dharmas is profound and lofty, and the ten sages cannot exhaust its bounds.

Second, next is the explanation of the name.
The sutra says The Sutra on the Contemplation of the Buddha of Immeasurable Life in one fascicle.
The word Buddha is the correct pronunciation in the Western Regions.

There are two aspects:
